description:
The '''Windmill scene''' is a [[Music community|musical scene]] that originated around the [[The Windmill, Brixton|Windmill]] pub in [[Brixton]], [[London]], during the late 2010s and early 2020s. The term is usually defined with a blend of [[experimental rock]] and [[post-punk]], featuring erratic, spoken vocals as well as inspiration from genres such as [[progressive rock]] and [[post-rock]]. A key figure on the scene's formation is producer [[Dan Carey (record producer)|Dan Carey]], who signed many Windmill bands to his record label, Speedy Wunderground, which has also given it the name '''Speedy scene'''. 

Among the bands described as being part of the scene are [[Black Midi]], [[Black Country, New Road]], [[Squid (band)|Squid]], [[Shame (band)|Shame]], [[Maruja (band)|Maruja]], [[the Last Dinner Party]], [[Fat White Family]], [[Heartworms (musician)|Heartworms]], [[Goat Girl]], [[PVA (band)|PVA]] and occasionally, [[Fontaines D.C.]]
